I am 100 percent sure that not all the relationships we have with others are perfect. This project will focus on a broken relationship. We have all been there, whether we are the person breaking the relationship, or the ones getting hurt at the other end. This relationship is not a relationship between lovers or friends. It’s a relationship between a father and a daughter. Through this project, I want the audience to perceive the reflection of their sometimes hidden and broken relationships they have, either with their father, mother, or any other person. I want to bring that awareness to the audience so they can be moved to go and search, or try to brings things into conclusion, although it will not always have a conclusion.Fiorella Galvez is a New Media Artist who loves both Animation and Graphic Design along with Information Technology. In animation, she has worked with both 2D and 3D animation with sound. In Graphic Design she has learned the foundation of creating visually appealing work, from infographics to a whole identity of a company. In Information Technology she has learned the basis of Programing and has become familiar with Webpage Development languages. Fiorella Galvez was born in Lima, Peru and was raised in Centreville, Virginia. She enjoys fellowshipping, spending time with her family and friends, along with playing and walking her Cocker-Eskimo puppy Mimo. She graduates in 2013 with a BA in Arts and Visual Technology and an Information Technology Minor from George Mason University.

name: Christina Peranski
artiststatement: Sustainability and self-sufficiency are critical issues to our world and how we will continue to survive in it. In order for a larger community interest or commitment in either to become possible, there must be knowledge, before passion. Using the developer program Tumult Hype 3, my piece is an animation-based, interactive web application. This application was built to be used for touch screen, primarily the iPad, and is also accessible online via URL. The content of this interactive web application seeks to interest and educate users about the dangers of corporate agribusiness practices, and the benefits of an organic lifestyle.Prior to studying art, biology and nutrition were my academic direction. I am motivated by societal impacts of nutrition and food quality, and hold strong affinity for science. All this informs my work in new media and animation. This app seeks to specifically educate using research on seed genetics and the reach of the Monsanto Corporation. It also aims to introduce present successful and active organic programs and local farms, specific to Virginia.Knowledge and truth on these matters are not common, but are growing. I intend for my work to make these subjects inviting, and introduce viewers to a lifestyle highly relevant to the quality of all of our futures.

name: Cameron Lensing
artiststatement: Originality is a battle every artist encounters and must overcome. How to truly be unique and different.”Define Yourself" invites viewers into a private environment to encourage self reflection on originality. The space allows for a complete removal from distractions and societal repercussions that may lead to a biased reflective moment.What truly defines usÛ what will we be remembered for decades after we pass, what sets us apart from the person to our left, to our right. Our name? Our likeness? Or our words. Our words can transcend time, can inspire, and can cause hate. Our words are what bond us and what make us different, what can free ourselves from this landscape of similarities.Being a twin, I live a constant struggle for originality. This is because I am not original on the surface. I may try to mask the similarities through clothing, but I will always be an appropriation, some part tied to the limitations of my physical being.True originality isn’t appropriated, isn’t altered. It isn’t a shell of one thing that is caked over with something different. It is bred from start to finish from the eye of the beholder. Individuals have the aptitude to draw from themselves what makes them original, what makes them unique. Every experience, every decision, is a testament to the original life you live. I ask a question that can be answered with one word or without enough words. A question even the most enlightened will go to their graves never being able to answer. I ask a question that is as much a paradox as it is rational, a question with an answer, and without. But above all, I provide an environment for the exploration of this question and protection from judgment or distraction.

name: Arthur Lugauskas
artiststatement: concept, concept. what is a concept? i think it’s something that i’m supposed to know when i’m asked, ”what is the concept behind your ´first ever five piop art walls’”? hmm, perhaps that question is a bit of a stumper. well, the dictionary definition that’s on my laptop defines ´concept’ as such: ´an abstract idea.’ so, if i connect a couple of things, this is what happens: ”the concept of my first ever five piop art walls is an abstract idea.” you know, sometimes i’m oblivious to the simplest things. i don’t know why. but, at the same time other times i’m able to connect dots like they’ve never been connected before. and what i care about is creativity, uniqueness, and amazingness.okay, well, let me tell you a few things about my five piop art walls throughout the 88,000 square foot soa building at gmu. we have a little bit of time, right? well, even though right now you’re the reader and i’m the writer, i want to have a brief conversation with you in this artist statement. i want a certain level of comfort and understanding to take place. and i don’t really feel like putting complex words together in a beautifully harmonious way that may be overly complicated with a certain formal structure that ´should’ exist in an artist statement. i could do that. i’ve done that in the past. but now, i want it to be you and me. pretend you’re standing outside on a sunny day in london and you see a newspaper with a title that says, ”arthur lugauskas is crazy because he thinks his piop art walls are ahead of their time.” and right next to that newspaper you see me - arthur lugauskas himself. and what am i doing? probably standing and thinking about this heading like i stand and think in front of walls when i do piop art on them. you decide to approach me and ask about my first ever five piop art walls that you saw during my senior art show at gmu. i kindly and, soon enough, passionately begin to speak and say the following:”well, i didn’t really know what i was doing. i kind of knew to an extent, but not fully. and i made up this term ´piop art’, which means ´perspectives inside of perspectives art’. i felt like that’s where a certain kind of art i was doing fit categorically. and i actually got criticized for making up this ´form of art’ and not fully knowing what i was doing. i was just being a kid, a creative, and having fun playing. and kids are the geniuses of todays day and age because they are everything and anything they want to be, they’re honest, they say what they feel and what’s real, and they’re leaders of their own thoughts and ideas. and note, i have ideas of what those first ever five piop art walls are about. like, they are my thoughts, ways of looking at space, inspiration for literally anyone who gives them some time, etc. these walls are probably about individuality actually. or maybe they’re more about you. choose to see what you want to see. which space do you want to enter? what’s your perspective on life when you analyze these walls more and more? and listen, what i want is for these walls to help you in your life, help you connect dots like no one ever will, bring the most creative creativity out of you, give you ideas to help advance society, design, architecture, thinking, and ideas themselves in ways that have never been tried or looked at. and then at some point i realized that these walls are ahead of their time if i think they could do such an impact to any individual that confronts them. and i know i’m ´not supposed’ to say that out loud. because i guess it’s an arrogant thing to say or it’s something about ego or whatever. but, it’s not about that. it’s about being creative, shaping your world the way you want to, not following what you think you should follow because of ´politics’ or ´societal norms’, and being individual and knowing that you could literally do anything you want in this world, call yourself whatever you think you are, and be anything. if you think of something or have dreams, don’t be afraid to let your thoughts out and make your dreams come true. too many people are afraid. maybe they’ll be judged, hated on, ridiculed, etc. but, don’t worry. currently there are more dreamkillers than dreamers out there. and note, the dreamers are the ones who change the world. i don’t want your dreams to die. and i’m holding onto my dreams, but i’m definitely getting beat up and talked trash about behind my back. i feel it. but, that’s what happens when you speak truth. that’s what happens when you’re real. and it’s not easy to give truth to people. but, it’s also not easy to take truth. well, it’s really all about perception. what’s your perception of me? i’m sure some people are thinking, ´don’t say anything, ever.’”
